sentences.english: A'cai, chief of Tu Gu Hun, had 20 sons.
sentences.chinese: 吐谷渾的首領阿豺有二十個兒子。

sentences.english: First of all, from a strategically advantageous position in the history of Tuyuhun summarized.
sentences.chinese: 首先高屋建瓴地對吐谷渾的歷史沿革進行了概述。

definition: ancient Central Asian city state, flourished in first millennium AD, in modern Aksu 阿克蘇地區|阿克苏地区, Xinjiang
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
Zhang Qian (-114 BC), Han dynasty explorer of 2nd century BC
Liu Yuan, warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晋, founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉 (304-347)
Nurhaci (1559-1626), founder and first Khan of the Manchu Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金 (from 1616)

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
posthumous name of the first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦 (256 or 247-195 BC), reigned 202-195 BC
Liu Yu, founder of Song of the Southern dynasties 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], broke away from Eastern Jin in 420, reigned as Emperor Wu of Song 宋武帝[Song4 Wu3 di4]
Later Zhou of the Five Dynasties (951-960), centered on Shandong and Hebei, with capital at Kaifeng 开封
Lintao county in Dingxi 定西[Ding4 xi1], Gansu
to meet on the battlefield (idiom)
punitive expedition to the east
(old) highest administrative post in border areas/governor of a march
Emperor Ming of Han (28-75), Western Han Dynasty Emperor 58-75
Emperor Xian of Han (181-234), the final Han emperor, set up by Dong Zhuo 董卓, reigned 189-220, forced to abdicate 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕
